newsitem.title: GERMANY: Spar confirms takeover of Promohypermarket.
newsitem.headline: Spar confirms takeover of Promohypermarket.

text.p: Germany's Spar Handels AG confirmed on Tuesday it had taken over Promohypermarket, the lossmaking German unit of French retailer Promodes SA.

Spar said in a statement that Promohypermarkt had 36 Continent stores across Germany, with combined turnover of 2.1 billion marks. Germany's cartel office must approve the deal, which is due to take effect on October 1.
Spar will add the new shops to its existing string of 49 Interspar stores, hoping to strengthen the chain and boost the company's overall competitive position, it added.
The company posted turnover in the last business year of 13.7 billion marks. It is Germany's eighth largest retailer.
